Join Coach Bob Cash this Saturday for an information session for any students -- and their parents -- interested in joining the Academic Decathlon (1 pm) or Pentathlon (2 pm) Team.

Academic Decathlon (9th-12th grades) and Pentathlon (6th-8th grades) teammates train all year for a variety of individual and team scrimmages, regional, state, and national competitions. This year's overarching theme is The Cold War. BASIS Scottsdale has advanced to Nationals for the past three years and both teams have secured awards on the national stage.

We are seeking students to compete in three distinct divisions:

Honors (GPA 3.8 or higher)
Scholastic (GPA 3.2-3.79)
Varsity (GPA less than 3.2)

Check out this evening's edition of the Bulldog Blast for more information and links!

An Update Regarding the 2020-21 School Year in Arizona

Dear BASIS Charter School families in Arizona,

We hope you are safe and well. We would like to provide you with an update regarding the start of the 2020-21 school year. post_text: "Meet Moose. We adopted Moose six years ago from Tranquility Trail Bunny Sanctuary. Moose was a neglected and discarded Easter bunny. He was kept in a wire cage outside in deplorable conditions. Moose was part of a hoarding rescue. We decided to take on the care of this little guy to help Tranquility Trail manage the large number is intakes from this hoarding situation. We fell in love with him and we found our forever bunny. Despite health challenges, he is very calm and affectionate. He thinks he is a dog so he uses the dog door to go out to do his business. He is completely potty trained so he has free range of the house. Moose hates to be picked up (he was not happy here in this photo) so we spend a lot of time with him on the floor (2nd picture) Moose enjoys devouring all sorts of greens planted in our yard just for his consumption." -Mademoiselle Jobin. Thanks For Sharing! #ShareWithUs #BASISScottsdale #BASISBulldogs #TeachersRock

Congrats to Adam H. , Senior Project ‚ÄúBlog of the Week!‚Äù

Adam is working at Chick-fil-A under the supervision of mentorship of Jesse Summer and his faculty advisor Mr. Johnson. Adam is designing a model to promote sustainable consumer behavior at Chick-fil-A. This project will document his time at Chick-fil-A, where he will continue to work with different managers to test different ways to decrease the impact of in-store waste. His analysis looks at the consumer's reaction to choice. and how being provided with different environmentally friendly options will affect their environment decision making. Adam hopes to reduce the amount of waste created by consumers while also ensuring the restaurant chain maintains its normal consumer basis.

Due to COVID-19, Adam is not working to help Chick-fil-A build long term response plans, or contingency plans, that will prepare the restaurant for what is to come.

https://www.basised.com/scottsdale/senior-projects/big-changes-building-a-covid-19-contingency-plan-at-chick-fil-a/

We rescued him 3 years ago ~ and he is so named because all he would do is screech and scream out of fear because he had been abused by his previous owners.

Congrats to Oliva W., Senior Project "Blog of the Week"!

Follow her blog here: https://www.basised.com/scottsdale/author/oliviaw/

Olivia is working at Arizona State University- Polytechnic, Department of Manufacturing Engineering, Advanced Materials Manufacturing Laboratory (AMAML) under the mentorship of Dr. Kenan Song and her faculty advisor, Mr. Lambert. Olivia is performing tests and analysis to determine the mechanical and electrical characteristics of the newly designed AMAML 3D printing-assisted nanocomposite sensors. Olivia's analysis will include results from scanning electron microscopy, tensile test, electrical conductivity, and testing the accuracy of the sensors in different solutions. Over the next 10 weeks, Olivia will conduct research in order to gain an understanding of the structure, components, material selection, sensing mechanisms, and production of these innovative chemoresistance nanocomposite sensors.

Congratulations to Kyle S., AP Research "Blog of the Week"!

https://www.basised.com/scottsdale/author/kyles/

Superconducting nanowire single-photon detectors (SNSPDs), the most recent type of single-photon detectors, have achieved high-speed, high-efficiency, low-noise single-photon detection. In recent years, technology has progressed to correct for limitations like constrictions and cooling to make SNSPDs very reliable and effective. The ultimate goal of Kyle's research is to experimentally confirm the relevance of SNSPDs for astronomical instruments and point to areas of application for further research to take advantage of the technology. In this research, a team of ASU graduate students and Kyle experimentally test the precision of the instrument by examining its signal-to-noise ratio and comparing it with an instrument that has no SNSPD.
